CreateApplication.document: This API is used to create an application.
CreateApplication.name: Creates an application

CreateCosToken.document: This API is used to generate a COS temporary key.
CreateCosToken.name: Generates a COS temporary key

CreateEnvironment.document: This API is used to create an environment.
CreateEnvironment.name: Creates an environment

CreateResource.document: This API is used to bind a cloud resource.
CreateResource.name: Binds a cloud resource

DeleteApplication.document:
This API is used to delete an application.
  - Stop running the current application
  - Delete resources related to the application
  - Delete the application
DeleteApplication.name: Deletes an application

DeleteIngress.document: This API is used to delete an ingress rule.
DeleteIngress.name: Deletes an ingress rule

DeployApplication.document: This API is used to deploy an application.
DeployApplication.name: Deploys an application

DescribeApplicationPods.document: This API is used to get the list of application pods.
DescribeApplicationPods.name: Gets the list of application pods

DescribeApplicationsStatus.document: This API is used to query the status of all applications in an envrionment.
DescribeApplicationsStatus.name: Queries the status of all applications in an environment

DescribeEnvironments.document: This API is used to get the list of tenant environments.
DescribeEnvironments.name: Gets the list of tenant environments

DescribeIngress.document: This API is used to query an ingress rule.
DescribeIngress.name: Queries an ingress rule

DescribeIngresses.document: This API is used to query the list of ingress rules.
DescribeIngresses.name: Queries the list of ingress rules

DescribeRelatedIngresses.document: This API is used to query the list of ingress rules associated with the application.
DescribeRelatedIngresses.name: Queries the list of ingress rules associated with the application

DestroyEnvironment.document: This API is used to terminate a namespace.
DestroyEnvironment.name: Terminates a namespace

GenerateApplicationPackageDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to generate the pre-signed download URL for the specified application package.
GenerateApplicationPackageDownloadUrl.name: Generates the pre-signed download URL for the specified application package

ModifyApplicationInfo.document: This API is used to modify the basic information of an application.
ModifyApplicationInfo.name: Modifies the basic information of an application

ModifyEnvironment.document: This API is used to edit an environment.
ModifyEnvironment.name: Edits an environment

ModifyIngress.document: This API is used to create or update an ingress rule.
ModifyIngress.name: Creates or updates an ingress rule

RestartApplication.document: This API is used to restart an application.
RestartApplication.name: Restarts an application

RestartApplicationPod.document: This API is used to restart an application pod.
RestartApplicationPod.name: Restarts an application pod

RollingUpdateApplicationByVersion.document: This API is used to configure the rolling update policy for an application.
RollingUpdateApplicationByVersion.name: Configures the rolling update policy for an application

StopApplication.document: This API is used to stop an application.
StopApplication.name: Stops an application

members.name: RepoName

members.name: EnableTracing

members.document: Parameters of the default image service
members.name: UseDefaultImageServiceParameters

members.document: Resource type. Valid values: `CFS` (file system), `CLS` (log service), `TSE_SRE` (registry)
members.name: ResourceType

Result
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Name of a scheduled scaling policy
members.name: Name

members.document:
Policy period
"* * *" indicates three ranges. The first is day, the second month, and the third week. The three parts are separated by spaces.
Examples:
* * * (every day)
* * 0-3 (every Sunday through Wednesday)
1,11,21 * * (1st, 11th, and 21st of every month)
members.name: Period

members.document: Details of a scheduled scaling policy
members.name: Schedules

members.document: Policy priority. The higher the value, the higher the priority. The minimum value is 0.
members.name: Priority

CronHorizontalAutoscalerSchedule.document: Details of a scheduled scaling policy

members.document:
Triggering time, in the format of HH:MM
Example:
00:00 (Trigger at midnight)
members.name: StartAt

members.document:
Number of target pods (less than 50)
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: TargetReplicas

members.document: Source channel. Please keep the default value.
members.name: SourceChannel

members.document: Whether to delete this application automatically when there is no running version.
members.name: DeleteApplicationIfNoRunningVersion

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Auto scaling configuration (This field is disused. Please use `HorizontalAutoscaler` to set the auto scaling policy.)
members.name: EsInfo

members.document:
Deployment type
- JAR: deployment through JAR package
- WAR: deployment through WAR package
- IMAGE: deployment through image
members.name: DeployMode

members.document:
When the deployment type is `IMAGE`, this parameter indicates the image tag
When the deployment type is `JAR` or `WAR`, this parameter indicates the package version number
members.name: DeployVersion

members.document: Package name, which is required when using JAR or WAR packages for deployment
members.name: PkgName

members.document:
JDK version
- KONA: use KONA JDK
- OPEN: use open JDK
- KONA: use KONA JDK
- OPEN: use open JDK
members.name: JdkVersion

members.document: Whether to add the registry's default configurations
members.name: UseRegistryDefaultConfig

members.document: ID of the version that you want to roll back to
members.name: VersionId

members.document: The script to run after startup
members.name: PostStart

members.document: The script to run before stop
members.name: PreStop

members.document: Auto scaling policy. (Disused. Please use APIs for auto scaling policy combinations)
members.name: HorizontalAutoscaler

members.document: Scheduled scaling policy (Disused. Please use APIs for auto scaling policy combinations)
members.name: CronHorizontalAutoscaler

members.document: Specifies whether to enable logging. `1`: enable; `0`: do not enable
members.name: LogEnable

members.document: Whether the configuration is modified (except for the image configuration)
members.name: ConfEdited

members.document: Whether the application acceleration is enabled
members.name: SpeedUp

members.document:
The version of the operating system
If `openjdk` is selected, the value can be: 
- ALPINE
- CENTOS
If `konajdk` is selected, the value can be: 
- ALPINE
- TENCENTOS
members.name: OsFlavour

members.document: Specifies whether to enable Prometheus metric
members.name: EnablePrometheusConf

members.document:
`1`: Enable APM tracing (Skywalking)
`0`: Disable APM tracing
members.name: EnableTracing

members.name: RequestId

members.name: BetaBatchNum

members.document: Batch deployment policy. `0`: automatically; `1`: manually; `2`: beta batch (manual), `3`: initial release
members.name: DeployStrategyType

members.document: The minimum number of available pods
members.name: MinAvailable

members.name: Limit

members.document:
The access type. Valid values:
- EXTERNAL (internet access)
- VPC (Intra-VPC access)
- CLUSTER (Intra-cluster access)

Subnet ID. It is filled when the access type is `VPC`.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SubnetId

Load balancer ID. It is filled when the access type is `EXTERNAL` or `CLUSTER`. It’s created automatically by default.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
